description.en: This vocabulary provides a controlled set of concepts for describing statistical measures and summary statistics generated by the QSV Data Wrangling package.

definition.en: Statistical measures and summary statistics generated by the 'stats' command in the QSV Data Wrangling package.
A least-frequent value among those that occur at least once (the rarest observed value).
The minimum non-zero frequency among observed values (count of the antimode).
The number of distinct values tied for the minimum non-zero frequency (the number of antimodes).
The average string length of non-null values.
The number of distinct (unique) non-null values.
The coefficient of variation of numeric values (stddev divided by mean).
The coefficient of variation of string lengths (stddev_length divided by avg_length).
The geometric mean of numeric values.
The harmonic mean of numeric values.
The interquartile range (Q3 − Q1).
Whether all non-null values contain only ASCII characters.
The lower inner Tukey fence for outliers (typically Q1 − 1.5×IQR).
The lower outer Tukey fence for outliers (typically Q1 − 3×IQR).
The median absolute deviation (median of |x − median(x)|).
The maximum observed value.
The maximum string length among non-null values.
The maximum number of decimal places observed for numeric values.
The arithmetic mean (average) of numeric values.
The minimum observed value.
The minimum string length among non-null values.
The most frequently occurring non-null value.
The frequency (count) of the mode value.
The number of distinct values tied for the highest frequency (the number of modes).
The number of numeric values that are negative.
The number of numeric values that are positive.
The number of numeric values that are exactly zero.
The number of null or missing values.
One or more percentile values (e.g., p10, p25, p50) computed for numeric columns.
The first quartile (25th percentile).
The median (50th percentile).
The third quartile (75th percentile).
The difference between the maximum and minimum values (max − min).
The standard error of the mean (estimated standard deviation of the sample mean).
A measure of asymmetry of the numeric value distribution.
A categorical indicator of whether values appear sorted (e.g., ascending, descending, or unsorted).
A numeric score indicating how close the column is to being sorted (higher means more sorted).
A measure of missingness, indicating how sparse the column is due to null or empty values.
The standard deviation of numeric values.
The standard deviation of string lengths across non-null values.
The sum of all numeric values.
The total string length across all non-null values (sum of character counts).
The inferred QSV field type for a column (e.g., string, integer, float, date).
The fraction of distinct values among non-null values (cardinality divided by valid count).
The upper inner Tukey fence for outliers (typically Q3 + 1.5×IQR).
The upper outer Tukey fence for outliers (typically Q3 + 3×IQR).
The variance of numeric values.
The variance of string lengths across non-null values.
Additional statistical measures and summary statistics generated by the 'moarstats' command in the QSV Data Wrangling package.
The Gini coefficient measuring inequality/dispersion of numeric values (0 = equal, 1 = maximal inequality).
The ratio of interquartile range to range (IQR/range).
A measure of tail-heaviness/peakedness of the distribution (kurtosis).
The z-score of the lower outer fence threshold: (lower_outer_fence − mean) / stddev.
The ratio of median absolute deviation to standard deviation (MAD/stddev).
The z-score of the maximum value: (max − mean) / stddev.
The ratio of the median to the mean (median/mean).
The z-score of the minimum value: (min − mean) / stddev.
The z-score of the mode value (mode minus mean, divided by stddev).
The coefficient of variation for non-outlier values (non_outliers_stddev/non_outliers_mean).
The mean of values classified as non-outliers (within inner fences).
The standard deviation of non-outlier values (within inner fences).
The variance of non-outlier values (within inner fences).
A measure of how much outliers shift the mean (difference between overall mean and non-outlier mean).
A normalized outlier impact measure expressed as a ratio (outlier_impact relative to a baseline mean).
The coefficient of variation for outlier values (outliers_stddev/outliers_mean).
Count of extreme lower outliers (values below the lower outer fence, typically Q1 − 3×IQR).
Count of extreme upper outliers (values above the upper outer fence, typically Q3 + 3×IQR).
The maximum value among outliers.
The mean of values classified as outliers.
Count of mild lower outliers (between lower outer and lower inner fences).
Count of mild upper outliers (between upper inner and upper outer fences).
The minimum value among outliers.
Count of values within the inner fences (non-outliers by the IQR rule).
The ratio of outlier standard deviation to non-outlier standard deviation (outliers_stddev/non_outliers_stddev).
The percentage of values classified as outliers (outliers_total_cnt / valid_count × 100).
The range among outliers (outliers_max − outliers_min).
The standard deviation of outlier values.
The ratio of outlier mean to non-outlier mean (outliers_mean/non_outliers_mean).
Total count of outliers outside the inner fences (mild + extreme).
The variance of outlier values.
Pearson’s skewness coefficient (a skewness estimate based on mean, median, and standard deviation).
The quartile dispersion coefficient, typically (Q3 − Q1) / (Q3 + Q1).
The ratio of the range to the standard deviation (range divided by stddev).
The standard error of the mean divided by the mean (SEM/mean).
The ratio of trimmed to untrimmed standard deviation (trimmed_stddev_25pct/stddev).
The coefficient of variation computed on the 25% trimmed sample (trimmed_stddev_25pct/trimmed_mean_25pct).
The mean after trimming 25% lowest and 25% highest values (middle 50% of the sample).
The range computed on the 25% trimmed sample.
The standard deviation computed on the 25% trimmed sample.
The variance computed on the 25% trimmed sample.
The z-score of the upper outer fence threshold: (upper_outer_fence − mean) / stddev.
The ratio of winsorized to untrimmed standard deviation (winsorized_stddev_25pct/stddev).
The coefficient of variation computed on the 25% winsorized sample (winsorized_stddev_25pct/winsorized_mean_25pct).
The mean after winsorizing 25% tails (clamping extreme values to the 25th/75th percentile boundaries).
The range computed on the 25% winsorized sample.
The standard deviation computed on the 25% winsorized sample.
The variance computed on the 25% winsorized sample.
